intro: Hieracium jahandiezii, commonly known as the Iranian hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Iran, where it thrives in rocky and alpine habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and it has a short, fibrous root system. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
